args: May I see you for a moment, Grace?
You had best be careful using my true\nname in front of Syndicate soldiers.\nYou know it is against policy.
Now, what was it that you needed,\nNumber 241?
I wanted to ask your opinion on the\nnumbers we received from this physical-\nenhancement experiment.
...Ah, so THAT'S where it went wrong!\nYou really are an incredible researcher.\nIt's like you know everything!
And I am rather impressed by your own\ncreativity. I think I could learn a great\ndeal from picking your brain.
Then why don't we get together for a\nmeeting of the minds tomorrow?\nEr...perhaps go out for a meal?
I received permission from the Preceptor\nfor both of us to leave the base.
So I was thinking maybe we could...\nget something to eat at the nearby town?\nBut only if you want, of course!
I'm sorry, Barth, but I fear I've nothing to\nwear for such an occasion save this outfit\nand a mourning gown.
Oh, then you can wear the gown!\nI don't mind. Really.
Yes, but I would feel rather awkward\ndining out in public in my widow's weeds.
Oh, of course! I'm so sorry—this was all\njust completely out of line. I'll go now.
Now that I think about it, it's possible\nthere wouldn't be as many people about\nif we went for a late dinner.
It certainly was—though I think I enjoyed\nour conversation as much as the meal.
(I know I shouldn't keep comparing Barth\nto my husband...)
(But my heart swells when I am with him.\nIt is as if I have gone back in time.)
Er, Grace? I know we've only just met,\nbut...I find myself quite charmed by you.
Both as a fellow researcher and...\nand as a man.
I know I can never replace your husband.\nBut I believe I can make you happy in the\nsame way he did.
So if you will have me—
Psst! I'll be waiting in that alley!
Er, I just remembered that I have a place I\nneed to be. I'll meet you back at the base.
You could stand to learn a bit of subtlety,\nBellina. Not every problem needs to be\nattacked straight on like a raging bull.
Okay, back off, toots! I'm just here to make\nsure you ain't forgot the reason you went\ninto that base in the first place.
Of course not. In fact, I have figured out\na plan for our rescue operation. Listen...
...Gotcha. In that case, I'll get back to the\nHalidom and recruit some extra hands.
Preparations will probably take a week,\nso I suggest having all your personal biz\nwrapped up by them.
Yeah, with the sad sack who's trying to put\nthe moves on you! He's your enemy,\nremember?
Barth is not like other people in the\nSyndicate. I believe we might be able\nto bring him to our side.
Well, you've got a week to find out.\nBut if lover boy over there won't switch \nsides, you know what you have to do.

Gra...I mean, Number 90, you have been
granted permission to access the Rank 4
documents you requested. Here is the key
to the storage shelf.

Oh, but I am jealous! I've requested access
to these documents dozens of times for
my work and have been turned away at
every opportunity.
Oh, and...about last night.\nPlease forget what I said.
I'll tell you what I wanted to say at another\ntime—and in a place where we can be\nassured of privacy.
Um...Researcher 241? What do you\nthink about the Syndicate?
I think it should reconsider how lightly it\ntreats the lives of test subjects.

The Syndicate is trying to right a world
filled with wrongs, but we can't make that
happen if we don't use the supplies we
have to their fullest extent.
I'm sorry. Did you just refer to the test\nsubjects as SUPPLIES?
Life is not something to be cast aside\nat a whim! Every life, no matter how\nmeager, can be of use to the Syndicate.
And that's how you really feel?
Of course! Those are the ideals of the\nSyndicate, and I joined because I agreed\nwith them. Was it not the same for you?
Y-yes, of course. Well, I must be going.
(I did not realize how fully immersed Barth\nis in the Syndicate's way of thinking.)
(So long as this is the case, he can never\nbe an ally to our cause.)
Well, you've got a week to find out.\nBut if lover boy over there won't switch\nsides, you know what you have to do.
Pump those little legs, you maggot!\nI want you at the training grounds NOW!
Enough. I cannot spent the rest of my time\nhere fretting about such things.

(Our plan does not end when we help
these captives escape—we must also
aid them in returning to their normal
lives after the pain they have suffered.)
(And we cannot do that if we don't learn\neverything there is to know about the\nSyndicate's research.)
This must be where they keep the\nRank 4 research papers. Let's see\nwhat we have here...

＂Observational Recordings of
Human-Weapon Hybrids...＂
＂Field Notes on Reconstructive
Entomological Surgeries...＂
Wait, hold on. ...What in the world?\n＂Magical Fusion Duplication＂?
But this experiment was performed by...!
